name: The Escalator
description: Progresses from internal fantasy through surveillance to action
psychology: Classic fantasy-to-action escalation. Builds internal pressure, then externalizes through observation before striking.
risk_profile: HIGH - Clear escalation trajectory. Intervention possible during Seeking/Conferring phases before transition to Directing.

name: The Fantasy-Actor
description: Direct leap from internal fantasy to violent action
psychology: Rapid fantasy-to-action without surveillance phase. Impulsive translation of internal urges into violence.
risk_profile: CRITICAL - Fast escalation. Short window for intervention between fantasy development and action.

name: The Stalker-Striker
description: Methodical observation followed by calculated action
psychology: Patient, methodical predator. Extended surveillance and target selection before striking.
risk_profile: HIGH - Surveillance phase offers detection opportunity. Once in Directing, highly dangerous.

name: The Ritualist
description: Cycles between action and ritual reinforcement
psychology: Compulsive pattern. Actions followed by ritualistic processing, which then triggers next action. Trophy-collector type.
risk_profile: HIGH - Predictable MO but compulsive drive. Rituals may provide behavioral indicators.

name: The Pure Predator
psychology: Pure exploitation focus. Minimal internal conflict or planning. Direct, sustained predatory behavior.
risk_profile: CRITICAL - Persistent danger. High Directing persistence means once active, remains active.

name: The Brooder
description: Extended internal struggle with periodic outbursts
psychology: Predominantly internal focus. Extended fantasy/conflict periods punctuated by explosive action. May appear withdrawn.
risk_profile: MODERATE - Long dormant periods but sudden violent episodes. Internal state may not signal imminent danger.

name: The Watcher
psychology: Extended surveillance orientation. Patient, methodical, information-gathering focus. May stalk for long periods.
risk_profile: MODERATE - Surveillance phase offers detection window. Danger increases as they move toward Directing.

name: The Chameleon
description: Utilizes all four behavioral modes fluidly
psychology: Most adaptable and unpredictable. Cycles through all states. May appear normal during Seeking/Conferring phases.
risk_profile: HIGH - Unpredictable transitions. Complexity makes behavior hard to anticipate. Corresponds to HUB role.

name: The Monomaniac
psychology: Rigid, inflexible pattern. Locked into exploitation mode. Limited behavioral repertoire.
risk_profile: CRITICAL - Constant danger while active. Predictable but relentless. No de-escalation phases.

name: The Late Bloomer
description: Dramatic escalation from passive to active in later phases
psychology: Long dormant or passive period followed by sudden activation. May have extensive Seeking/Conferring history before first offense.
risk_profile: MODERATE initially, CRITICAL after transition. Early phases may not predict later violence.

name: The Cycler
psychology: Rhythmic behavioral pattern. May correspond to cooling-off periods. Cycles of buildup, action, and processing.
risk_profile: VARIABLE - Risk depends on current phase. Pattern may be predictable once identified.
